title: Ideal gas law - calculate temperature in new state

content.description: An ideal gas is enclosed in a cylinder with a movable piston. The gas is initially in State <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"> <mtext>A</mtext> </math> at a temperature of <math alttext="190 kelvins" overflow="scroll"><mn>190</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi></math> and is taken from State <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> to State <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> along the path shown in the <math alttext="P V" overflow="scroll"><mi>P</mi><mi>V</mi></math> diagram.
content.question: What is the temperature of the gas in State <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"> <mtext>B</mtext> </math>?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
